snippet: Houzaifa Konditamdé, a native of Burkina Faso, became deaf at age 6, but that did not stop him from dancing, as the photographer Arthur Nazaryan has been documenting since 2014.
abstract: Photographer Arthur Nazaryan has spent year documenting Houzaifa Konditamde, deaf immigrant from Burkina Faso who has become deeply involved with traditional African dance while living in Bronx.
lead_paragraph: Houzaifa Konditamdé, a native of Burkina Faso, became deaf at age 6, but that did not stop him from dancing, as the photographer Arthur Nazaryan has been documenting since 2014.

headline.print_headline: Deaf, but Deep Into the Beat
headline.main: A Deaf Dancer From Africa Makes a New Life in New York
